Then went <S%H3318><s%> Haman <S%H2001><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> that day <S%H3117><s%> joyful <S%H8056><s%> and with a glad <S%H2896><s%> heart: <S%H3820><s%> but when Haman <S%H2001><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Mordecai <S%H4782><s%> in the king's <S%H4428><s%> gate, <S%H8179><s%> that he stood <S%H6965><s%> not up, nor <S%H3808><s%> moved <S%H2111><s%> for him, he was full <S%H4390><s%> of indignation <S%H2534><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> Mordecai. <S%H4782><s%>

And Haman <S%H2001><s%> told <S%H5608><s%> them of the glory <S%H3519><s%> of his riches, <S%H6239><s%> and the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of his children, <S%H1121><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the things wherein <S%H834><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> had promoted <S%H1431><s%> him, and how <S%H834><s%> he had advanced <S%H5375><s%> him above <S%H5921><s%> the princes <S%H8269><s%> and servants <S%H5650><s%> of the king. <S%H4428><s%>

Haman <S%H2001><s%> said <S%H559><s%> moreover, <S%H637><s%> Yes, Esther <S%H635><s%> the queen <S%H4436><s%> did let no <S%H3808><s%> man come <S%H935><s%> in with the king <S%H4428><s%> to the banquet <S%H4960><s%> that she had prepared <S%H6213><s%> but myself; and to morrow <S%H4279><s%> am I invited <S%H7121><s%> to her also <S%H1571><s%> with the king. <S%H4428><s%>
